channel.title: Why websites show IPv6 when I use Tor Browser on Whonix?
channel.description:
Every time I use Tor Browser on Whonix WS, I always visit: 1. whatismyipaddress. com 2. myip. ms 3. whatismyip. com
What I found was: that websites always show me the IPv6 not IPv4.
The IPv6 they show is exactly like this: (I change the number) 1. whatismyipaddress. com - **4001:831:10f0:0:0:0:0:31** 2. myip. ms -> **5b0d:f270:0:5::443** 3. whatismyip. com -> **3221:23f9:c:67h:0:0:0:3**
My question is: 1. What happened to Whonix? 2. Does Whonix expose my MAC address? 3. Why does every website show different numbers? 4. Why when I close Whonix and access WhatIsMyIP. com from Chrome, this website does not display IPv6 but IPv4?

item.title: Why websites show IPv6 when I use Tor Browser on Whonix?
item.dc:creator: no_space
item.description:
Ohh so good. Thank you very much Patrick for your answers… I do not worry anymore right now.

Read full topic

item.title: Why websites show IPv6 when I use Tor Browser on Whonix?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix

Browser Tests

check.torproject.org says "Sorry. You are not using Tor."? On false positives. And browser fingerprinting. How unique are you? On Browser Tests and Br...

no_space:

What happened to Whonix?

Nothing. Tor supports IPv6.

no_space:

Does Whonix expose my MAC address?

No.

Whonix

MAC Address

MAC Address Spoofing and Tracking Threats

no_space:

Why does every website show different numbers?

Whonix

Stream Isolation

Prevent Identity Correlation through Circuit Sharing by using Tor Stream Isolation

no_space:

Why when I close Whonix and access WhatIsMyIP. com from Chrome, this website does not display IPv6 but IPv4?

Your ISP doesn’t support IPv6 most likely or it’s disabled in your router, operating system or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Why websites show IPv6 when I use Tor Browser on Whonix?
item.dc:creator: no_space
item.description:
Every time I use Tor Browser on Whonix WS, I always visit:

  1. whatismyipaddress. com
  2. myip. ms
  3. whatismyip. com

What I found was: that websites always show me the IPv6 not IPv4.

The IPv6 they show is exactly like this: (I change the number)

  1. whatismyipaddress. com - 4001:831:10f0:0:0:0:0:31
  2. myip. ms -> 5b0d:f270:0:5::443
  3. whatismyip. com -> 3221:23f9:c:67h:0:0:0:3

My question is:

  1. What happened to Whonix?
  2. Does Whonix expose my MAC address?
  3. Why does every website show different numbers?
  4. Why when I close Whonix and access WhatIsMyIP. com from Chrome, this website does not display IPv6 but IPv4?

Read full topic
